definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

sentences.english: He cocked his hat and twirled his stick.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子，挥舞着手杖。

sentences.english: The conjurer waved his magic wand and pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师挥舞魔杖，从帽子里拉出一只兔子。

sentences.english: A corollary of that is I hate flag waving.
sentences.chinese: 以上导致的必然结果是，我讨厌国旗挥舞。

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of flag-waving activists called for early elections.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计挥舞着国旗的积极分子要求提早进行选举。

sentences.english: I say, make time to dance a hop, one hand waving free.
sentences.chinese: 要我说，花点时间为自己跳支舞，一只手在空中挥舞。

sentences.english: Not long after, a guard came in, waving a blindfold.
sentences.chinese: 不久之后，一个看守进来，手里挥舞着蒙眼用的布条。

sentences.english: Chinese policeman tries to convince a knife-wielding man to release a hostage on a street in Guangzhou, China.
sentences.chinese: 警察试图说服挥舞刀具的男子释放人质。

sentences.english: Waving a red cloth, he was picked up by a boat.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着一块红布，随后被一艘船只救起。

sentences.english: People were craning out of the windows and waving.
sentences.chinese: 人们把身子探出窗外，挥舞着手。

sentences.english: Shield bashing will be added, basically making dual wielding of weapons possible.
sentences.chinese: 盾扑将增加，基本上使双挥舞的武器可能。

sentences.english: But you'd rather see it wave after green flags upon the platform.
sentences.chinese: 你却更爱它月台上绿旗后的挥舞。

sentences.english: At that moment, the Jade Emperor flew past on a turbulent cloud, waving his arms.
sentences.chinese: 在那时，玉皇大帝挥舞著双手，乘著一片乱云飞过。

sentences.english: A hollow metal rod with a heavy rubber tip or tips that is wielded and twirled by a drum major or drum majorette.
sentences.chinese: 鼓手挥舞使用的，顶端是厚橡皮的中空的金属棒。

sentences.english: He charged at me with his head down and both fists flying.
sentences.chinese: 他低着头挥舞着双拳向我冲了过来。

sentences.english: As soon as the boys entered the field the farmer come after them waving a big stick.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一进入农田，那农场主就挥舞着大棒追了过来。

sentences.english: She walks across a levee, blowing a whistle and waving her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她在大堤上走来走去，吹口哨，挥舞着胳膊赶鸟。

definition: to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to attack with a bladed weapon
